img.alt: Harambee Institute of Science and Technology Charter School

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-home current-menu-item page_item page-item-40 current_page_item menu-item-1015

li.a: Our Mission, Vision, and Core Values
Our School Culture: The Harambee Way

div.h6: Harambee Institute of Science and Technology Charter School

div.p: This morning, “the Pennsylvania Secretary of Education, Pedro Rivera, issued an order under Act 12 of 2020 to close all public schools through the conclusion of the 2019-2020 academic year as defined by our school calendar.

We will continue providing instructional and counseling services to our children through our current Enrichment and Review protocol through April 2020 but will transition to a Planned Instructional program beginning in May 2020. Please see the message below from our CEO for more details.

Given the disruption to the instructional time that our students experienced as a result of COVID-19, we have modified our spring break schedule for teachers and staff. Wednesday, April 8, Thursday, April 9, and Monday, April 13, 2020 are now scheduled workdays. All teachers and staff will maintain their virtual office hours and will continue to engage with our students and families.
Harambee will be closed on Friday, April 10, 2020, in observance of Good Friday.

h5.strong: Please continue to check our website and Class Dojo for updates.

p.span: To help ensure that our students do not fall behind in their learning, we have made available learning packets for our students. These packets may also be found on
Class Dojo. We strongly encourage you to take advantage of the learning opportunities that we have provided.

div.a: FAQs on School Closure from PDE
A Message from the AP for Instruction
FREE Meals for Students: City Meal Distribution Sites

div.p: The health, safety, and welfare of our students, teachers, and families are our top priorities. As such, Harambee is carefully following the recommendations and guidelines from the Pennsylvania Department of Education (PDE), the Pennsylvania Department of Health (DOH), and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on the steps we can take to help prevent the spread of the virus.

We have made our cleaning routines more robust and added hand sanitizer dispensers in our hallways. As always, we disinfect all touch points throughout the building daily. We have shared specific instructions with our students and teachers on the importance of washing their hands and staying home if they feel sick. Stay connected for updates, information, and resources.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_blurb et_pb_blurb_0 et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_blurb_position_top

div.div:
Counseling services are available for Harambee students who are having extreme difficulty coping during this difficult time. Parents can reach Mama Goldie, School Counselor, via email at gbarnes@histcs.org. Mama Goldie can help with a plan for de-escalation and goal-setting.
COVID-19 Resources for the Home
VYH Supply Distribution
Helping Children Cope With Changes Resulting From COVID-19
Supporting teenagers and young adults during the coronavirus crisis
Coronavirus Resources & Tips for Parents, Children & Others
Parent/Caregiver Guide to Helping Families Cope With the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)

p.a: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

iframe.title: What You Need To Know About Handwashing

div.h2: Our Mission, Vision, and Core Values
div.p: Harambee Institute exists to offer our community an education with a focus on the origins, current status, and future of the African world.
Our mission is to educate students to succeed as global citizens with a clear awareness of “who I am, where I am from, where I am going, and how I get there.”
Our vision is a collective and informed African-American community utilizing science and technology as a means of promoting education for self-reliance, locally and globally.
1. Greatness: Pursuit of excellence in all we do
2. Accountability: Owning what we do and who we are
3. Innovation: Open to new ideas with a growth mindset
4. Integrity: Honesty, transparency, and unity in all we do

div.div: Help us build something great. HISTCS teachers, staff, and advisory groups are working hard everyday to create a high-quality student experience. If you’re a parent, community leader, or part of a larger organization we urge you to sign up for one of our volunteer or sponsorship opportunities, or attend any of our upcoming events. Lets pull together for our kids and our community!

h2.a: School Closed Monday, March 16, 2020 through Friday, March 27, 2020

div.p: Today, Governor Tom Wolf announced the closure of all Pennsylvania schools for two weeks, beginning Monday, March 16, 2020. To comply with this order, Harambee Institute of Science and Technology will close on Monday, March 16 through Friday, March 27, 2020. No...

div.p: While there have been no cases of Coronavirus (COVID-19) at Harambee Institute of Science and Technology, we are taking all necessary precautions to protect the health and well-being of the members of our school community. To this end, our Annual Literacy Night on...

article.class: et_pb_post clearfix post-11222 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-homepage-news

div.p: Each year our school relies upon support from our community leaders to help our teachers and staff provide many excellent and enriching educational opportunities to our students. This is a fundraiser gala page, where we are launching our 2020 board of directors drive....

div.h1: Founded in 1973, HISTCS is Pennsylvania’s first African-centered charter school
div.span: The Harambee Institute of Science and Technology Charter School (HISTCS) was established as one of Philadelphia’s first public charter schools and Pennsylvania’s first African-centered charter school.

div.h4: HARAMBEE INSTITUTE OF SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY CHARTER SCHOOL

div.p:
640 N. 66th Street, Philadelphia, PA 19151
Phone: 215-472-8770
Email: info@histcs.org
FAX: 215-472-9611
Hours of Operation:
Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm

div.div: Harambee is a K-8 charter school serving over 500 students residing in Philadelphia and the surrounding area. As a public school, Harambee is open to all Pennsylvania students, with priority given to Philadelphia residents and siblings of current students.
